content: Can Anyone can provide help me to setup right configuration of Sendgrid in self hosted server
My employer give me just one day to resolve this issue. Please help me :hurt:

Can Anyone can provide help me to setup right configuration of Sendgrid in self hosted server
My employer give me just one day to resolve this issue. Please help me :hurt:
@Umair Khan Rind You can find information on setting up Outgoing email on this page.
3 messages were moved here from #issues > Sendgrid Configuration Issue by Lauryn Menard.

@Umair Khan Rind - Just a heads up that I moved your messages all to this topic. Please note in this community's guidelines that you don't need to ask questions in multiple places as core people read all of the public streams.

Don’t ask the same question in multiple places. Moderators read every public stream, and make sure every question gets a reply.

Another suggestion I have until one of the production folks is online to help would be to search for topics in this stream with "sendgrid": https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/31-production-help/search/sendgrid
There might be something in one of those conversations that's relevant to your questions.
@Lauryn Menard Sorry for that. But i have configured my server as per your community guideline. but its not working.
@Umair Khan Rind - The documentation for setting up outgoing email is different from the community guidelines.

The community guidelines are about how to communicate here in this community. So for example, there's generally no need to mention core contributors, which is noted here:

Use @-mentions sparingly. Unlike IRC or Slack, Zulip‘s topics make it easy to see what you’re replying to, so you don’t need to mention your conversation partner to make sure they will see or understand your reply. Core contributors will often @-mention someone who asked a question hours earlier to make sure they see the reply, but there is generally no need to @-mention a core contributor unless you need their timely attention.

Again, I'm not one of the people who will be able to help you with this as this isn't my area of knowledge / expertise, but giving more information about what issues you're having will help other people who do have knowledge in this area know how to respond.
